yes it can if you install a special software
windows can read ext   only if you use a special program that is installed. Otherwise  windows by itself can't read such a format/filesystem.
did you use the space up?
so you have a blank 4 gig memory and it would show 512mb or something not 4gb.
did you try taking it out waiting about 5 min and putting it back in.
format it to ntfs.  You will need to go to the dependancies and  install  a program that will read ntfs format.
boot into windows and then format the flash drive to ntfs. Then in ubuntu do to system, -> admin, then SPM  which is ubuntu package manager.  then search ntfs
you should find couple program. Read the descriptions:  one should say make ntfs readable   you would want that one.
